content.raw:
No labscript programs trigger this error when run from within their directories according to my testing. BLACS was the only one doing it, solely because of mixing absolute and relative imports. The other ones only do relative imports (well, sortof - it's complicated. They import in a way that Python treats as absolute if you run `__main__.py` from within the directory, but counts as relative if you do 'python -m'), but since they will shift to absolute imports with porting to python 3 it will be good to have this in there to make sure we get them all (and don't introduce any mixed imports in the future).

Happy to merge?
